get.summary: Query for filterable values inside a radius
get.description:
Returns filterable values around the current location on the map, within a certain radius.
For the latitude and longitude values used in the request, returns the available and unavailable values for the following fields:

  * brand

  * payment methods

  * amenities

get.summary: Query for gas stations
get.description:
There are two ways to search for gas stations in a geo location. You can use either one, or none, but not both ways.

To search inside a specific radius around a given longitude and latitude provide the following query parameters:

* latitude
* longitude
* radius

To search inside a bounding box provide the following query parameter:

* boundingBox

parameters.name: filter[poiType]
parameters.description: POI type you are searching for (in this case gas stations)

parameters.name: filter[appType]
parameters.description: Search only gas stations with fueling app available

parameters.name: filter[boundingBox]
parameters.description:
Bounding box representing left, bottom, right, top in degrees. The query parameters need to be passed 4 times in exactly the order left, bottom, right, top.
#ValueLat/LongRange
0leftLat[-180..180]
1bottomLong[-90..90]
2rightLat[-180..180]
3topLong[-90..90]

parameters.name: compile[openingHours]
parameters.description: Reduces the opening hours rules. After compilation only rules with the action open will remain in the response.

get.summary: Get a mapping from gas station specific fuel product name mapped to a normalized fuel type
get.description: Every gas station potential has different names for the same fuel types. This endpoint accepts the gas station's specific name and return a mapping where the specific name is mapped to a normalized version which should be globally the same across gas stations.

get.summary: Get price history for a specific gas station
get.description: Get the price history for a specific gas station and fuel type on a period of time which can begin no sooner than 37 days ago; the time interval between price changes can be set to minute, hour, day, week, month or year

parameters.name: fuel_type
parameters.description: Filter after a specific fuel type

parameters.name: filter[from]
parameters.description: Filters data from the given point in time

parameters.name: filter[to]
parameters.description: Filters data to the given point in time

parameters.name: filter[granularity]
parameters.description: Base time interval between price changes

delete.summary: Deletes a previously created POI subscription

post.description: Get a list of map tiles in the Protobuf binary wire format.

get.summary: Query for location-based apps
get.description:
These location-based PACE apps deliver additional services for PACE customers based on their current position.
You can (or should) trigger this whenever:
* A longer stand-still is detected
* The engine is turned off
* Every 5 seconds if the user "left the road"

Please note that calling this API is very cheap and can be done regularly.

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of apps
get.description: Returns a paginated list of apps optionally filtered by type and/or query.

parameters.name: filter[appType]
parameters.description: Filter for poi type, no filter returns all types
Filters the location-based app by its caching method.
parameters.name: filter[cache]
filter[since]
parameters.description: Filters location-based apps that were changed (created/updated/deleted) since the given point in time

get.summary: Returns App with specified id
get.description:
Returns App with specified id.
In case the query returns a `404` (`Not Found`) the app was deleted and should be deleted from any caches.

Allows an admin to move a POI identified by its ID to a specific position

at.description: The datetime of the price value

price.description: The price at this point in time

createdAt.description: Time of subscription creation (iso8601 without time zone)

updatedAt.description: Time of LocationBasedApp last update (iso8601 without time zone)

expiresAt.description: Time when the subscription will expire, must not be more then 60 days in the future (iso8601 without time zone)

conditions.description:
Optional conditions to reduce the number of notifications to the device. For a notification to be fired, all conditions need to be true.
The example reads as `fuelPrice < 1.3 && fuelType == "diesel"`. For or conditions use multiple subscriptions.

fuelPrice.description: Condition on the fuelPrice of a gas station.

lt.description: Fuel price is less then given amount. Amount is always given in the currency of the gas station. The units are not scaled, for `EUR`, the value 1.3 means 1 euro and 30 cents.

fuelType.description: Condition on the fuelType of a gas station

eq.description: Fuel type is equal to given value

pushToken.description: PRN describing the push token. E.g. FCM token.

pwaUrl.description:
Progressive web application URL. The URL satisfies the following criteria:
  • The URL responds with `text/html` on a GET request
  • The response contains HTTP caching headers e.g. `Cache-Control` and `ETag`
  • HTTP GET request on the URL with an `ETag` will return `304` (`Not Modified`), if the content didn't change
  • If `503` (`Service Unavailable`) is returned the request should be retried later
  • If `404` (`Not Found`) is returned the URL is invalidated and a new app should be requested

cache.description: A location-based app is by default loaded on `approaching`. Some apps should be loaded in advance. They have the cache set to `preload`.

createdAt.description: Time of LocationBasedApp creation (iso8601 without time zone)

updatedAt.description: Time of LocationBasedApp last update (iso8601 without time zone)

deletedAt.description: Time of LocationBasedApp deletion (iso8601 without time zone)

Progressive web application URL. The URL satisfies the following criteria:
  • The URL responds with `text/html` on a GET request
  • The response contains HTTP caching headers e.g. `Cache-Control` and `ETag`
  • HTTP GET request on the URL with an `ETag` will return `304` (`Not Modified`), if the content didn't change
  • If `503` (`Service Unavailable`) is returned the request should be retried later
  • If `404` (`Not Found`) is returned the URL is invalidated and a new app should be requested

cache.description: A location-based app is by default loaded on `approaching`. Some apps should be loaded in advance. They have the cache set to `preload`.

metadata.description: a JSON field containing information about data field origin and update time

ID of the for the referenced object

createdAt.description: Time of POI creation in (iso8601 without zone - expects UTC)

timeToLive.description: Time to live in seconds (in relation to other entries)

schema.description: JSON field describing the structure of the updates sent by the data source

lastDataAt.description: timestamp of last import from source

countries.description: list of ISO-3166-1 ALPHA-2 encoded countries

status.description: Availability status of the referenced resource

fuelType.description: Normalized name, i.e., converted to a fuel type.

lower.description: Price value indicator below which a price is considered cheap

upper.description: Price value indicator after which a price is considered expensive

average.description: Average price for this fuel type

id.description: UUID of the POI that is considered as origin of all the other POI duplicate UUIDs

MoveRequest.description: Creates a new event object at lat/lng from this POI ID

Fuel.description: Fuel type for cars, based on the EU fuel marking

CommonCountryId.description: Country this policy applies to (as ISO3166Alpha2)

timezone.description: As defined by ISO 8601, the timezone

from.description: relative to the specified time zone (local time)

to.description: relative to the specified time zone (local time)

Errors.description: Error objects provide additional information about problems encountered while performing an operation.

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

about.description: A link that leads to further details about this particular occurrence of the problem.

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like title, this fields value can be localized.

source.description: An object containing references to the source of the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

BadRequest.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error

NotAcceptable.description: The specified Accept header is not valid

InternalServerError.description: A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable.

UnsupportedMediaType.description: The specified Content-Type header is not valid

UnprocessableEntity.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

MovedPermanently.description: Resource was permanently moved to new location

scopes.poi:pois.references:read: Enabled additional reference data on the poi

DeviceID.name: Device-ID
DeviceID.description: Authentication using a unique device id. This is allows usage of the api without a user account. The device id has to be 32 bytes long and is best generated with a secure random function. E.g. `3b5cb427432aee46a2aa1dbad6f1c7629ec7928ce732afdd73ff7554b9c46272` generated using `openssl rand -hex 32`. The device id may not be the same across a re-install of the app. In case the device id is lost, all data stored with that device id is lost. If a device ID is not seen for a longer time period, the data may be deleted.
